definition: abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: Killing an alien gives you some points.
sentences.chinese: 杀死一个外星人会给您加分。

sentences.english: The boy importuned the teacher to raise his mark.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩缠着老师给他加分。

sentences.english: Experience with social coupon sites like Retailmenot, Tjoos, Couponit, or more is an even bigger plus.
sentences.chinese: 经验与社会数据库是一个巨大的加分。

sentences.english: They set up a chart to reward him with points or ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 他们制定了一个奖惩表，用加分或冰激凌奖励他。

sentences.english: Why I can not add points here?
Some people never take the trouble to analyse, they simply follow the "wind".
sentences.chinese: 有些人对任何事物都不加分析，完全以“风”为准。

sentences.english: In the end, though, I figured it was best to cover the shift and score some points at work.
sentences.chinese: 但最后我想还是去代班来替工作加分好了。

sentences.english: New Zealand adopts the British forum non conveniens doctrine without careful analysis.
sentences.chinese: 新西兰不加分析地采用了英国的不方便法院原则。

sentences.english: Gabby : My mom said summer jobs look good on college applications.
sentences.chinese: 我妈说暑假实习上大学申请报告能加分的。

sentences.english: Hemingway-style camping and superb service are other pluses.
sentences.chinese: 海明威式的露营和极好的服务是另外的加分。

definition: (neologism c. 2009) don't worry, it's all taken care of
the brush stroke that dots in the eyes (idiom); fig. to add the vital finishing touch/the crucial point that brings the subject to life/a few words to clinch the point
attractiveness index (rating of how good-looking sb is)
lit. on brocade, add flowers (idiom); to decorate sth already perfect/gilding the lily
to pair up/to match/to arrange in pairs/to add sth into a group
to paint a dragon and dot in the eyes (idiom); fig. to add the vital finishing touch/the crucial point that brings the subject to life/a few words to clinch the point
conspicuous/to make sth stand out/make sth prominent
